text.p: Cytel Corp on Monday said it has received a $500,000 payment from Baxter Healthcare Corp's Nextran unit for delivering an initial batch of a bioactive carbohydrate for use in Nextran's xenotransplantation product.

Under a collaboration agreement signed in October, Nextran made an up-front payment and an equity investment in Cytel for the right to enter into an exclusive supply agreement for the carbohydrate with Cytel's Glycotechnology business unit.
The agreement provides for further product development milestone payments to Cytel. Xenotransplantation is the process of transplanting animal organs into humans.
